headline: Oracle (ORCL) Deploys OpenAI’s GPT-5 Across Database and Cloud Applications
summary: Oracle Corporation (NYSE:ORCL) is one of the Trending AI Stocks in Focus This Week. This includes Oracle Fusion Cloud Applications, Oracle NetSuite, and Oracle Industry Applications, such as Oracle Health. Being OpenAI’s fastest, smartest model […]

headline: Layoffs For AI: Oracle Pulls A Meta—Will Investors Buy The Efficiency Story?
summary: Oracle Corp (NYSE:ORCL) is cutting staff, and investors are already sizing up the playbook: is this the lean efficiency of a cloud titan, or a warning flag in disguise? Roughly 10% of its Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) workforce in India has been let go, a move the company frames as part of a broader pivot toward automation and AI-driven growth. Track ORCL stock here. Trimming Staff, Boosting AI The OCI layoffs echo Meta's "Year of Efficiency" in 2023, when Facebook slashed about 21,000 roles

headline: OpenAI CFO Sees Firm Selling AI Infrastructure Service in Future
summary: The service would be loosely inspired by the success Amazon.com Inc. found renting out its spare cloud computing capacity to companies, OpenAI Chief Financial Officer Sarah Friar said in an interview Wednesday.  In recent years, OpenAI has gained expertise on how to design and set up data centers to optimize workloads for AI.  “If all we do is buy from others, all we’re doing is giving them our IP because they’re learning how to build AI infrastructure,” Friar said.

headline: Clari Wins Inc. 5000 Award for Fourth Consecutive Year, Leading the Future of Revenue AI
summary: SUNNYVALE, Calif., August 20, 2025--Clari today announced its inclusion in the annual Inc. 5000 list for the fourth consecutive year. This list is the most prestigious ranking of the fastest-growing private companies in America. The list provides a data-driven snapshot of the most successful companies within the economy’s most dynamic segment — its entrepreneurial businesses. Past honorees include companies such as Microsoft, Meta, and Oracle.

headline: Heard on the Street Tuesday Recap: Big Tech Stumbles, Markets Fall
summary: A drop in megacap technology stocks pushed major indexes into the red.  The eight companies valued at more than $1 trillion lost a combined $385 billion in market capitalization.  The Nasdaq Composite closed down 1.5%.

headline: Palantir Stock Got Clobbered.  Where the Chart Says It’s Headed Next.
summary: Megacap software stocks have been dragging on the broader tech sector—I previously flagged this potential shift, highlighting growing weakness in Microsoft, Oracle, and CrowdStrike—and the risk of a deeper selloff is rising.  The stock, which fell 2.3% to $701.03 on Tuesday, has fallen in nine of the last 14 sessions, and as the fifth-largest holding in the iShares Expanded Tech-Software Sector ETF, its recent weakness adds pressure to an already fragile group.

headline: Firebolt Expands in APAC with Singapore Hub, Appoints Deepak Ajmani to Lead Regional Growth
summary: Firebolt, the analytical database for real-time applications, today announced a major expansion across APAC, driven by unprecedented demand from organizations accelerating their data and AI initiatives. As part of this growth, Firebolt has opened a new regional hub in Singapore to strengthen its presence across the region. To lead this effort, Firebolt has appointed Deepak Ajmani as Head of Asia & ANZ.
